alert.note: Alert for Blair (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL BLAIR COUNTY THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hollidaysburg, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Roaring Spring, Martinsburg, Claysburg, East Freedom and Altoona-Blair County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
